snippet: A rising sense of panic has emerged among the middle class, which is bearing the economic burden as the West ratchets up pressure on the Iranian regime.
abstract: Profound anxiety courses through Iran's middle class as the nation's currency collapses by the day; evidence of the panic is seen in the stockpiling of staples and the furtive crowds of men gathering in the shadows of Tehran's streets to buy and sell American dollars; fuel for the manic trade is not an actual economic collapse but the pressure of continued sanctions on Iran's Central Bank that have begun inflicting unprecedented damage on Iran's private sector.
lead_paragraph: A rising sense of panic has emerged among the middle class, which is bearing the economic burden as the West ratchets up pressure on the Iranian regime.

headline.seo: In Iran, Rising International Tensions Take a Toll
headline.main: Iran’s Middle Class on Edge as World Presses In
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Middle Class on Edge as World Presses In
